parameters.name: T.kind
parameters.description: Kind represents the type of the API object.

parameters.name: T.api-version
parameters.description: APIVersion defines the version of the API object. This can only be set by the server.

parameters.name: meta.name
parameters.description: Name of the object, unique within a Namespace for scoped objects. Must start and end with alpha numeric and can have alphanumeric, -, _, . Length of string should be between 2 and 64.

parameters.name: meta.tenant
parameters.description: Tenant to which the object belongs to. This can be automatically filled in many cases based on the tenant the user, who created the object, belongs to. Must be alpha-numerics. Length of string should be between 1 and 48.

parameters.name: meta.namespace
parameters.description: Namespace of the object, for scoped objects. Must start and end with alpha numeric and can have alphanumeric, -, _, . Length of string should be between 2 and 64.

parameters.name: meta.generation-id
parameters.description: GenerationID is the generation Id for the object. This is incremented anytime there is an update to the user intent, including Spec update and any update to ObjectMeta. System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: meta.resource-version
parameters.description: Resource version in the object store. This is updated anytime there is any change to the object. System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: meta.uuid
parameters.description: UUID is the unique identifier for the object. This is generated on creation of the object. System generated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: meta.creation-time
parameters.description: CreationTime is the creation time of the object. System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: meta.mod-time
parameters.description: ModTime is the Last Modification time of the object. System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: meta.self-link
parameters.description: SelfLink is a link for accessing this object. When the object is served from the API-GW it is the URI path. Example: - "/v1/tenants/tenants/tenant2" System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: B.uri
parameters.description: URI is the root node from where to query. Length of string should be between 2 and 512.

parameters.name: B.query-type
parameters.description: QueryType is the direction of the query.

parameters.name: B.max-depth
parameters.description: Max-Depth specifies how deep the query should explore. By default depth is set to 1 which means immediate relations 0 means to maximum depth.

parameters.name: B.count-only
parameters.description: When CountOnly is set the response only contains counts and not the actual objects.

name.description: Must start and end with alpha numeric and can have alphanumeric, -, _, . Length of string should be between 2 and 64.

tenant.description: Must be alpha-numerics. Length of string should be between 1 and 48.

namespace.description: Must start and end with alpha numeric and can have alphanumeric, -, _, . Length of string should be between 2 and 64.

label-selector.description: LabelSelector to select on labels in list or watch results.

field-selector.description: FieldSelector to select on field values in list or watch results.

field-change-selector.description: FieldChangeSelector specifies to generate a watch notification on change in field(s) specified.

from.description: From represents the start index number (1 based - first object starts from index 1), of the results list. The results returned would be in the range [from ... (from + (max-results - 1))]. If From = 0, the server will attempt to return all the results in the list without pagination.

max-results.description: MaxResults is the maximum number of results to be returned as part of the response, per page If MaxResults is more than the maximum number of results per page supported by the server, the server will return an err If MaxResults is 0, the server will return all the results without pagination.

sort-order.description: order to sort List results in.

name.description: Must start and end with alpha numeric and can have alphanumeric, -, _, . Length of string should be between 2 and 64.
name.title: Name of the object, unique within a Namespace for scoped objects

tenant.description: This can be automatically filled in many cases based on the tenant the user, who created the object, belongs to. Must be alpha-numerics. Length of string should be between 1 and 48.
tenant.title: Tenant to which the object belongs to

namespace.description: Namespace of the object, for scoped objects. Must start and end with alpha numeric and can have alphanumeric, -, _, . Length of string should be between 2 and 64.

generation-id.description: This is incremented anytime there is an update to the user intent, including Spec update and any update to ObjectMeta. System generated and updated, not updatable by user.
generation-id.title: GenerationID is the generation Id for the object

resource-version.description: This is updated anytime there is any change to the object. System generated and updated, not updatable by user.
resource-version.title: Resource version in the object store

uuid.description: This is generated on creation of the object. System generated, not updatable by user.
uuid.title: UUID is the unique identifier for the object

labels.title: Labels are arbitrary (key,value) pairs associated with any object

creation-time.description: System generated and updated, not updatable by user.
creation-time.title: CreationTime is the creation time of the object

mod-time.description: System generated and updated, not updatable by user.
mod-time.title: ModTime is the Last Modification time of the object

self-link.description: When the object is served from the API-GW it is the URI path. Example: - "/v1/tenants/tenants/tenant2" System generated and updated, not updatable by user.
self-link.title: SelfLink is a link for accessing this object

apiObjectMeta.description: ObjectMeta contains metadata that all objects stored in kvstore must have.

namespace.description: Namespace of the object, for scoped objects.

kind.description: Kind represents the type of the API object.

name.description: Name of the object, unique within a Namespace for scoped objects.

uri.description: URI is a link to accessing the referenced object.

apiObjectRef.description: ObjectRef contains identifying information about an object.

result.description: Result contains the status of the operation, success or failure.

message.description: Message contains human readable form of the error.

code.description: Code is the HTTP status code.

object-ref.description: Reference to the object (optional) for which this status is being sent.

apiStatus.description: Status is returned for calls that dont return objects.

apiStatusResult.description: StatusResult contains possible statuses for a NIC.

kind.description: Kind represents the type of the API object.

api-version.description: APIVersion defines the version of the API object. This can only be set by the server.

apiTypeMeta.description: TypeMeta contains the metadata about kind and version for all API objects.

uri.description: Length of string should be between 2 and 512.

browserBrowseRequest.description: BrowseRequest is the query request for the dependency tree.

browserBrowseRequestList.description: BrowseRequest is the query request for the dependency tree.

uri.description: URI is the root node from where to query. Length of string should be between 2 and 512.

query-type.description: QueryType is the direction of the query.

max-depth.description: Max-Depth specifies how deep the query should explore. By default depth is set to 1 which means immediate relations 0 means to maximum depth.

count-only.description: When CountOnly is set the response only contains counts and not the actual objects.

browserBrowseResponseList.description: BrowseResponseList is the response to a querylist request.

root-uri.description: RootURI is the root node for the response.

query-type.description: QueryType is the direction of the query.

max-depth.description: MaxDepth that the response explored. Reflects the value specified in the query.

total-count.description: TotalCount of objects in the response.

objects.description: map of results. Key to the map is the URI of the  Object.

browserBrowseResponseObject.description: BrowseResponse is the response to a query request.

uri.description: URI is the Browser URI for this object.

reverse.description: Reverse is the view from the object looking back in the reverse direction of the dependency tree.

query-type.description: QueryType specifies the direction of the relations in Links.

links.description: Links points to the relations of the object. The key for the map is the path to the filed which is causing the relation.

browserObject.description: Object is a node in the dependency tree representing a config object with links to related objects.

type_url.description: A URL/resource name whose content describes the type of the serialized protocol buffer message. For URLs which use the scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, the following restrictions and interpretations apply: * If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed. * The last segment of the URL's path must represent the fully qualified name of the type (as in `path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form (e.g., leading "." is not accepted). * An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][] value in binary format, or produce an error. * Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage breaking changes.) Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

googleprotobufAny.description: `Any` contains an arbitrary serialized protocol buffer message along with a URL that describes the type of the serialized message. Protobuf library provides support to pack/unpack Any values in the form of utility functions or additional generated methods of the Any type. Example 1: Pack and unpack a message in C++. Foo foo = ...; Any any; any.PackFrom(foo); ... if (any.UnpackTo(&foo)) { ... } Example 2: Pack and unpack a message in Java. Foo foo = ...; Any any = Any.pack(foo); ... if (any.is(Foo.class)) { foo = any.unpack(Foo.class); } Example 3: Pack and unpack a message in Python. foo = Foo(...) any = Any() any.Pack(foo) ... if any.Is(Foo.DESCRIPTOR): any.Unpack(foo) ... Example 4: Pack and unpack a message in Go foo := &pb.Foo{...} any, err := ptypes.MarshalAny(foo) ... foo := &pb.Foo{} if err := ptypes.UnmarshalAny(any, foo); err != nil { ... } The pack methods provided by protobuf library will by default use 'type.googleapis.com/full.type.name' as the type URL and the unpack methods only use the fully qualified type name after the last '/' in the type URL, for example "foo.bar.com/x/y.z" will yield type name "y.z". JSON ==== The JSON representation of an `Any` value uses the regular representation of the deserialized, embedded message, with an additional field `@type` which contains the type URL. Example: package google.profile; message Person { string first_name = 1; string last_name = 2; } { "@type": "type.googleapis.com/google.profile.Person", "firstName": <string>, "lastName": <string> } If the embedded message type is well-known and has a custom JSON representation, that representation will be embedded adding a field `value` which holds the custom JSON in addition to the `@type` field. Example (for message [google.protobuf.Duration][]): { "@type": "type.googleapis.com/google.protobuf.Duration", "value": "1.212s" }.
